div.a: SCHOOL BOARD MEETING CHANGE NOTICE CHARLEROI AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT

br.span:
NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN THAT the following committee and regular voting meetings of the Charleroi
Area School District Board of School Directors for Tuesday, April 21, 2020 will be changed to the
following times: Athletics Committee – 4pm; Personnel, Curriculum & Instruction Committee – 4:15pm;
Finance Committee – 4:30pm; and Regular Voting Meeting – 5pm. The above meetings will be
conducted virtually only due to current restrictions regarding mass gatherings. Members of the public
wishing to participate may join the meeting via the internet or by phone. Please visit
www.charleroisd.org for information on how to join the meeting. Anyone wishing to sign up for public
comment is asked to email the Superintendent prior to the start of the meeting at
[email protected] Please include your name, address, phone number, and any affiliation in the
email. If you need accommodations, please call Becky Kline at 724-483-3509.
LOG IN INFORMATION:
To participate in the meeting via videoconference, please visit:
https://zoom.us/j/92594757979?pwd=ejlyUGhZVEV3Q2xRR3F2MnRMSkNIUT09
To participate in the meeting via telephone, please call: (301) 715-8592
Meeting ID: 925 9475 7979
Meeting Password: 026368

div.a: CASD 4th Quarter Grading Plan During Online Instruction

p.span: We began remote learning on March 30, 2020 and had a two week acclimation period for our students. In order to preserve the efforts and accomplishments of our students during the first three quarters of this 2019-2020 year,

span.style: font-size: 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: we will maintain our existing grading system for the final quarter of the year.
Our students have worked hard during the first three quarters of the school year and we believe that final grades should be representative of those efforts.

Fully recognizing the challenges of Covid-19 and remote online instruction, our teachers will adjust instruction and assessments throughout the fourth quarter. Maintaining our current percentage grading system as usual will allow teachers to communicate our students’ accomplishments in a system that is familiar to both students and parents. Our expectations for students during the fourth quarter are that they put forth their best efforts to engage in learning under the very challenging conditions that currently exist. High school students in the honors classes will have additional expectations due to the potential for the honors’ weighted grade.

Students’ grades, such as assessments, assignments and participation, for the fourth quarter will be updated by their teachers on a weekly basis in the GoEdustar gradebook system. Work assigned on or after April 13, 2020 will be entered in GoEdustar for the fourth quarter grade. Additionally, end of year final exams will not be given in any course. Friday, June 5th is the last instructional day of the 2019-2020 school year.
Charleroi Area School District commits to providing the following levels of support for students experiencing difficulty during continuity of instruction at home:
Level 1
- If students are in need of tech support, students/families should submit a help ticket at

span.style: font-size: 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: . If the student/family cannot complete the electronic help ticket, they can call their child’s school secretary for assistance with submitting a ticket. Please include the name and grade level of the student, the particular issue and a phone number for the parent.
Elementary Building Secretary: 724-483-3509 Ext. 2261 or Ext. 2260
Middle School Building Secretary: 724-483-3509 Ext. 3011
High School Building Secretary: 724-483-3509 Ext. 3010 or Ext. 3030
Level 2

- Students who are not engaged in their learning will be first addressed at the teacher level. Teachers will contact students and/or parents multiple times with meaningful two way communication to address concerns and resolve issues with at home learning.
Level 3

- If students continue to be disengaged in their learning, teachers will contact school counselors to share the student concerns and how the student was addressed by the teacher. School counselors will reach out to the student and/or parent to assist in resolving the matter.
Level 4

- If school counselor intervention is not successful, the school counselor should contact the school principal. The principal will communicate with the parent and student in order to resolve the students issue with online instruction.
Level 5

- If principal intervention is not successful, the superintendent of schools will be notified. The district superintendent will contact the family in order to try to resolve the online learning issue.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: If students fail to participate in online learning, it is possible that they will be retained to the same grade level for the 2020-2021 school year.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-top: 12px; color: #212121; font-size: 15px; text-decoration-line: inherit; line-height: 1.6667

span.p: In addition to the Parents Online – Parent Portal, parents have access to the FREE go.edustar Parent App. This App will allow parents fast and easy access to their student(s) Grades, Attendance, Schedule and Personal Information.

p.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-top: 12px; color: #212121; font-size: 15px; text-decoration-line: inherit; line-height: 1.6667
p.strong: Parents can download a FREE App from the online retailers based on the device they use.

p.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-top: 12px; color: #212121; font-size: 15px; text-decoration-line: inherit; line-height: 1.6667

span.p: Apple Products – Parents would visit the Apple App Store and search for go.edustar to download the free App.

p.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; margin-top: 12px; color: #212121; font-size: 15px; text-decoration-line: inherit; line-height: 1.6667
p.span: – Parents would visit the Google Play Store and search for
to download the free App.

p.style: margin-top: 12px; color: #212121; font-size: 15px; text-decoration-line: inherit; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; line-height: 1.6667

span.p: See our distance learning page at https://sites.google.com/charleroisd.org/casd-virtual-learning/home for more information.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; color: #222222; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif
p.span: April 9, 2020

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; color: #222222; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif
p.span: Greetings to Charleroi Area Students, Staff, Parents, and Community,

We want to provide an important update to the entire Charleroi Area learning community. The Pennsylvania Secretary of Education issued an order this morning to close all public schools through the end of the 2019-2020 academic year as defined by the local school calendar. In addition, Governor Wolf is ordering all K-12 schools and programs, public and private, to be closed through the end of the 2019-2020 academic year. Pennsylvania Pre-K Counts, Head Start Supplemental Assistance Programs and Preschool Early Intervention programs will remain closed, and institutions of higher learning are prohibited from offering in-person instruction.

The decision in Pennsylvania is consistent with many other states. As part of our ongoing communications with all stakeholders, we will update you after spring break with many of the key concepts and questions regarding the closure of our brick and mortar school for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

It is important to note that we will continue to implement our Continuity of Education Plan and Google classroom online learning platform for the rest of the 2019-2020 academic school year. We are very pleased with the approach and the collaborative support for this program. It is important for students to continue with our plans in order for us to implement grades and promotion. If students fail to participate in online learning, it is possible that they will be retained to the same grade level for the 2020-2021 school year. Please note that June 5, 2020 is the last scheduled academic day for our 2019-2020 school calendar. If you have any questions about completing classwork, please contact your child’s teacher or school.

The student parent and staff feedback toward online learning has been extremely positive. Online learning though our school district will resume on Tuesday, April 14, 2020. We will continue to learn and grow together in the upcoming weeks.
Thank you for your continued support of the Charleroi Area School District. We will continue to share our plans with you in the upcoming weeks.
Hope you and your family have a wonderful spring break.
Sincerely,
Ed

div.span: Letter to Parents and Guardians March 29, 2020

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; color: #222222; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif
p.span: Dear Charleroi Learning Community,

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; color: #222222; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif

span.style: font-size: 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman, serif; color: black

p.span: We look forward to working with you and your children once again in order to provide our students with a continuity of education plan beginning on Monday, March 30

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; color: #222222; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif

span.style: font-size: 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman, serif; color: black

p.span: This is a new way of learning for us all, and we will work with you to help make this a successful experience. Naturally, with any new initiative, there may be questions from students and parents. Some terminology and procedures may seem new and unfamiliar, but please be assured that this initial difficulty will pass with practice. Please familiarize yourself with our webpage @ www.charleroisd.org and particularly the CASD Quick Start and Learning Resource guide weblinks
which provides contact information for various questions about online instruction.

span.a: CASD Quick Start Guide: Chromebooks and Google Apps

p.span: School District
Charleroi Area
Superintendent
Edward J Zelich
Address
125 Fecsen Drive
Charleroi, PA 15022
Email/Phone
Website
Goal of Plan

The purpose of the Charleroi Area School District (CASD) Continuity of Education Plan is to provide guidance and support to continue providing educational learning opportunities for students in an environment of prolonged closures based on feasibility and availability of resources
The goal in providing learning opportunities during this difficult time is to continue to maintain the mission of inspiring all students to achieve their greatest potential.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap

br.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We are actively monitoring the COVID-19 situation and are planning to prepare for future instruction in case schools remain closed for a long period of time. With that in mind, we are asking that you please

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: regarding technology access for your children at home. The survey can be found by visiting:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If you are unable to complete this electronic survey form for any reason, please feel free to call your child’s school to provide the requested information via telephone.

br.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please be safe.

span.div: As we navigate through these next few weeks, CASD will be providing a Grab and Go lunch for any child 2-18 years old.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: If you would like to use this service, please
to complete the
. Please complete form by 11pm the night before.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.p: Lunches will be available for pick up, starting Monday, March 16, 2020 from 11am-12pm, weekdays only, at the Charleroi High School (outside Auditorium Lobby), Fallowfield Volunteer Fire Department (rear entrance), Charleroi Volunteer Fire Department Annex (beside Fire Department), Stockdale Fire Department, and Lock No. 4 Volunteer Fire Department (in front of Garage doors). Unfortunately, with the state closures of libraries, John K Tener library will no longer be a site for picking up lunch as previously communicated.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: When picking up lunches, there will be no congregating or hanging around the Food Pickup locations. Also, there is no access to the buildings at this time.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: In the days to follow, we will reassess the needs and provide more information.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Order Form Link:

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: March 13, 2020

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dear Charleroi Area School District Learning Community,

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I am writing to provide an update regarding the Charleroi Area School District plans for the COVID-19 pandemic. Currently, we are navigating unchartered waters as we try to prepare a coordinated and systematic response to this pandemic. Our overall goal is to help contain the spread and mitigate the impact of the virus. More cases of the COVID-19 are expected in our state in the coming days.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In response to a report from Center for Disease Control, school closures are recommended for a minimum of two weeks. Out of an abundance of caution, the Charleroi Area School District will be closed beginning at the end of the school day on

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Friday, March 13, 2020,

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: and classes will be cancelled through

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Friday, March 27, 2020

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Classes are expected to resume

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Monday, March 30, 2020.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The mainlines of communication will be through the Charleroi Area School District website

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: and via the district-wide phone messaging system. Again, tentative plans are to resume school on Monday, March 30, 2020. Please be advised, the duration of closure depends solely on an assessment of COVID-19 risk.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: During district closure, we will be suspending all activities for the duration of the two-week period. All district facilities, including athletic facilities will be unavailable for use until further notice.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In an effort to continue support for our students and families, the district will have free take-out lunches available on the weekdays from 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. Monday, March 16, 2020-Friday, March 27, 2020. Meals may be picked up at either Charleroi Area High School Cafeteria

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: or

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: at the J.K. Tenner Library. Please follow signs at each location directing where to pick up meals. Please note that this service will not be available on weekends. To help with meal count, we would appreciate if you would kindly call into your child’s building by 12:00 p.m. the day prior to your child receiving a take-out lunch. Please watch the website for further updates and information on intended food services.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: It is our sincere hope as a district that you will continue to talk with your children about their questions and concerns regarding the risks of COVID-19. These are trying times, even for the youngest in our school community. This is not the school year we envisioned for our children, but we must continue to support one another and take the appropriate preventative actions to maintain the health and safety of our students, families, and community members. If we can show compassion for those who are ill or caring for sick family members, empathy for each other, and patience during this strenuous time, we will end up stronger.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Yours in Education,

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Edward J. Zelich, Ed. D.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Superintendent of Schools

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

div.a: Coronavirus: A Letter from the Superintendent

p.span: Dear Parents/Guardians:
To date, there are 7 presumptive positive cases of COVID•19 in Pennsylvania. Counties impacted to date include:
The purpose of this communication is to provide resources and information regarding the coronavirus disease

(COVID-19), which has become an issue of concern in the medical community. The Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Pennsylvania Department of Health (DOH) have issued a number of informational pieces to the public, and the CDC believes the immediate risk of this new virus to the American public is low at this time.
What we know about the coronavirus disease is that it is a flu and respiratory illness that can spread from person to person. Symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
The Charleroi Area School District has implemented the following preventative measures:

li.span: Cleaning frequently touched surfaces (desks, doorknobs, and cafeteria tables).
Encouraging student handwashing or use of hand sanitizers.
Encouraging students to avoid sharing items such as drinks, unpackaged food, and eating utensils.

p.span: Our staff will remain vigilant in helping to identify any student who appears to be exhibiting symptoms of this virus and send the student to the school nurse for evaluation. The school nurse will contact you if a physician follow-up should be recommended.
If you feel your son/daughter is exhibiting any signs of the coronavirus disease, please keep your child home from school and immediately contact your physician.
For more information about the coronavirus and the steps to help prevent illness, please view the following website:

div.span: The Charleroi Area School District is accepting applications for Substitute Cafeteria workers

br.span:
Now Hiring!!
Want to work the same hours as your children?
Want weekends off?
The Charleroi Area School District Cafeteria is the place for you!
The Charleroi Area School District is accepting applications for Substitute Cafeteria workers for the the 2019-2020 School Year, with a possibility of permanent employment. Substitute pay rate is $10 per hour. The positions available vary in start times.
Mandatory clearances and trainings include Act 126 – Mandated Reporter Training, Act 151 – PA Child Abuse Clearance, Act 34 – PA Criminal Clearance, and Act 114 – Federal Fingerprint Clearance.
Applications can be found online at charleroisd.org or in the Administrative Office located on campus. If you have any questions, please contact Rob Lenhart at 724-483-3573 extension 3028.

span.style: font-family:Times New Roman, serif; font-size: 12pt; text-align: justify

p.span: "An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure." Clearly preventing school threats and violence is better than reacting to them. With this famous quote in mind, the most preventive measure our learning community can employ is to obtain information about potential threats before an individual decides or begins to take action. We continue to encourage and ask our students, staff, and community for their support by reporting concerns to an administrator or through our Safe2Say School Hotline.

As with every incident or questionable conversation reported to us, our administrative team and school resource police officers have been working intently since yesterday regarding an Instagram page that shows videos of students fighting both inside the school and off campus. While the page was just created yesterday, some of the incidents that were videotaped had occurred weeks or even months ago, and those students had already been disciplined for their conduct. This afternoon, we were able to determine who was responsible for the Instagram page; the page has now been deleted and the videos are no longer available to be seen. While we cannot explain student discipline issues further than that, we can assure you that all appropriate steps to investigate and stop this matter were taken immediately. As with every decision we make, the health, safety, and welfare of our students, faculty, and staff was our primary concern.

Students, parents and community members should use the Safe2Say Hotline to report threats of violence, suicide, bullying and illegal activity that could harm children in our schools. The hotline is administered by an independent, outside company. All communications are PRIVATE, CONFIDENTIAL, and ANONYMOUS. The Safe2Say Hotline can be accessed at 1-844-SAF2SAY, or online at www.safe2saypa.org

Our staff members at Charleroi continue to set aside time with students to listen and encourage them to be a part of the solution. We want to encourage parents and families to have these conversations at home as well. The National Association of School Psychologists published a helpful resource on Talking to Children about Violence. You can find that here.

These are certainly tough times for our schools and communities, and we know that students will follow the examples set by adults. We continue to work with our staff to assist them in doing what they can to maintain a sense of calm and reason in our schools. If you have questions, please feel free to contact me or your building principal.
Sincerely,

div.a: Alice Training at Charleroi High School July 15 and 16, 2020

br.span:
Dear Charleroi Area Learning Community:
The Charleroi Area School District is committed to creating and sustaining a comprehensive, coordinated effort to improve the overall safety and well-being of our students, educators, and administrators
We believe this effort must involve community-wide programs and initiatives involving parents, teachers, administrators, local law enforcement, mental health and wellness professionals, and elected officials to take meaningful action to protect our students.
The “Safe2Say Something” (S2SS) anonymous reporting system has been implemented in our district. This program is mandated under PA state law/Act 44. It teaches students, teachers, and administrators how to recognize potential warning signs and signals, especially on social media, from individuals who may be a threat to themselves or others. It encourages students to Say Something to a trusted adult OR use its anonymous reporting system. Specifically, the program educates participants to:
Recognize the signs and signals of at-risk behaviors – including on social media
Take every sign and signal seriously and act quickly to get help by talking to a trusted adult OR
Report it anonymously through the S2SS Office of the Attorney General 24/7 Crisis Center, mobile app, or website
Respond to and manage the submitted tip via school-based multi-disciplinary educator and administrator teams
Sustain the curriculum and awareness via student clubs, in-school activities, and call-to-action weeks
Our students are our most important resource in keeping our students safe because they are often aware of the problems their peers are facing. S2SS teaches our students how to recognize danger signs in their surroundings and on social media, and empowers them to act quickly with the assistance of trained and caring adults.
In order to keep the channels of communications open and clear, we want to inform our families about the required training that is scheduled for the week of February 4, 2019. Students in grades 5-12 will be trained on how to report concerns to a trusted adult or use the anonymous reporting system. Our goal is to provide families with an opportunity to preview the content prior to the training. Copies of the S2SS brochure and training video are listed below for your review.
S2SS Brochure
S2SS Training Video (Grades 5-8)
S2SS Training Video (Grades 9-12)
The S2SS program is provided by Sandy Hook Promise (SHP), a nationwide non-profit organization dedicated to keeping our students safe. SHP’s programs are used in all 50 states, with 10,000+ schools and over 5.5 million students and adults trained. They have the track record, reputation, and knowledge to work effectively with kids, parents, and teachers to improve school safety and culture. They also have the funding to provide and sustain a research-based and age-appropriate program at NO COST to school districts across the state.
We anticipate that S2SS will help stop school shootings, suicides, and gun threats; help identify bullying and cyber bullying; and help mitigate cutting, drug use, racial conflicts, and other acts of violence and victimization.
Sincerely,
Dr. Edward J Zelich
Superintendent, Charleroi Area School District
Support Charleroi Area School District Education Foundation by shopping at AmazonSmile. When you shop at AmazonSmile, Amazon will donate to CASDEF....

img.alt: Harvest's Bounty is a Weekend Food Program image
img.a: Harvest's Bounty is a Weekend Food Program

br.span: Harvest’s Bounty is a weekend food program for students in grades K-8. It is designed to help provide a little more to insure students have nutritious food that prepares them to be academically successful in the Charleroi Area School District. Applications are available through the schools and here on the website at http://www.charleroisd.org/harvestsbounty.aspx
